```{r}
f1 <- function(x){
  result <- x^2-5
  return (result)
}

f2 <- function(x){
  result <- sqrt(x)
  return (result)
}
```

```{r}
print(f2(3))
```

```{r}
a
```

```{r}
#f(a, b) = (a + b)ab
f <- function(a, b) {
  fab <- (a+b)%*%a%*%b
  return(fab)
}
f(a,b)
```
### 2.2
```{r}
#2.2

m <- matrix(c(3:6),2,2,TRUE)
n <- matrix(c(2:5),2,2,TRUE)
m
n
```

```{r}
#h(m, n) = |m|n − mn
h <- function(m,n){
  mn <- det(m)*n - m%*%n
  return(mn)
}
h(m,n)
```

## Constant function

Reference for plot types can be accessed here http://www.sthda.com/english/wiki/generic-plot-types-in-r-software
```{r}
f <- function(x){
  #suppose c = 2
  fx <- 2
  return (fx)
}

input <- 1:10
plot(input, sapply(input, f), type = "l", xlab = "x", ylab = "y")
```

## Linear Function

```{r}
f <- function(x){
  #a=1 and b=2
  fx <- 1*x+2
  return(fx)
}

input <- -1:10
plot(input, sapply(input, f), type = "l", xlab = "x", ylab = "f(x)")
```
## Quadratic Function
```{r}
f <- function(x){
  #a<0
  fx <- -1*x^2+2*x+1
  return(fx)
}

input <- -20:22
plot(input, sapply(input, f), type = "l", xlab = "x", ylab = "f(x)")
```
## Polynomial Function
```{r}
f <- function(x){
  fx <- x^3-3*x^2+x-1
  return(fx)
}

input <- seq(-10, 11, 0.1)
plot(input, sapply(input, f), type = "l", xlab = "x", ylab = "f(x)")
```
## Rational Function
```{r}
f <- function(x){
  fx <- 1/x
  return(fx)
}

input <- seq(-10, 10, 0.1)
#to remove 0 from the domain of f
input <- input[-which(input==0)]
plot(input, sapply(input, f), type = "p", xlab = "x", ylab = "y")
```


## Exercise 4
```{r}
#f(x) = sin(x)
f <- function(x) {
  fx <- sin(x*pi/180)
  return(fx)
}

input <- seq(-180,180,0.1)
plot(input, sapply(input, f), type = "l" , xlab = "x" , ylab = " plot f(x)" )
```
